verses.verse: I said <WH559> in my heart, <WH3820> "Come now, <WH3212> I will test <WH5254> you with mirth: <WH8057> therefore enjoy <WH7200> pleasure; <WH2896>" and behold, <WH1892> this also was vanity.
I said <WH559> of laughter, <WH7814> "It is foolishness; <WH1984>" and of mirth, <WH8057> "What <WH2090> does it accomplish? <WH6213>"

I searched <WH8446> in my heart <WH3820> how to cheer <WH4900> my <WH1320> flesh with wine, <WH3196> my heart <WH3820> yet guiding <WH5090> me with wisdom, <WH2451> and how to lay hold <WH270> of folly, <WH5531> until I might see <WH7200> what it was good <WH2896> for the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> that they should do <WH6213> under heaven <WH8064> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of their lives. <WH2416>
I made myself great <WH1431> works. <WH4639> I built <WH1129> myself houses. <WH1004> I planted <WH5193> myself vineyards. <WH3754>
I made <WH6213> myself gardens <WH1593> and parks, <WH6508> and I planted <WH5193> trees <WH6086> in them of all kinds of fruit. <WH6529>
I made <WH6213> myself pools <WH1295> of water, <WH4325> to water <WH8248> from it the forest <WH3293> where trees <WH3293> were reared. <WH6779>

I bought <WH7069> male servants <WH5650> and female servants, <WH8198> and had servants born <WH1121> in my house. <WH1004> I also had great <WH7235> possessions <WH4735> of herds <WH6629> and flocks, <WH1241> above all who were before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem; <WH3389>

I also gathered <WH3664> silver <WH3701> and gold <WH2091> for myself, <WH5459> and the treasure of kings <WH4428> and of the provinces. <WH4082> I got <WH6213> myself male <WH7891> and female singers, <WH7891> and the delights <WH8588> of the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120>—musical instruments, <WH7705> and that of all sorts.
So I was great, <WH1431> and increased <WH3254> more than all who were before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem. <WH3389> My wisdom <WH2451> also remained with me. <WH5975>

Whatever my eyes <WH5869> desired, <WH7592> I didn't <WH680> keep from them. <WH4513> I didn't withhold my heart <WH3820> from any joy, <WH8057> for my heart <WH3820> rejoiced <WH8056> because of all my labor, <WH5999> and this was my portion <WH2506> from all my labor. <WH5999>

Then I looked <WH6437> at all the works <WH4639> that my hands <WH3027> had worked, <WH6213> and at the labor <WH5999> that I had labored <WH5999> to do; <WH6213> and behold, <WH1892> all was vanity and a chasing <WH7469> after wind, <WH7307> and there was no profit <WH3504> under the sun. <WH8121>

I turned <WH6437> myself to consider <WH7200> wisdom, <WH2451> madness, <WH1947> and folly: <WH5531> for what can the <WH120> king <WH4428>'s <WH935> successor <WH310> do? <WH6213> Just that which has been done long ago. <WH3528>
Then I saw <WH7200> that <WH3426> wisdom <WH2451> excels <WH3504> folly, <WH5531> as far as light <WH216> excels <WH3504> darkness. <WH2822>

The wise man <WH2450>'s eyes <WH5869> are in his head, <WH7218> and the fool <WH3684> walks <WH1980> in darkness <WH2822>—and yet I perceived <WH3045> that one <WH259> event <WH4745> happens to them all. <WH7136>

Then <WH227> I said <WH559> in my heart, <WH3820> "As it happens <WH4745> to the fool, <WH3684> so will it happen <WH7136> even to me; <WH1571> and why was I then more <WH3148> wise? <WH2449>" Then I said <WH1696> in my heart <WH3820> that this also is vanity. <WH1892>

For of the wise <WH2450> man, <WH5973> even as of the fool, <WH3684> there is no memory <WH2146> for ever, <WH5769> since <WH3528> in the days <WH3117> to come <WH935> all will have been long forgotten. <WH7911> Indeed, <WH2450> the wise man must die <WH4191> just like the fool! <WH3684>

So I hated <WH8130> life, <WH2416> because the work <WH4639> that is worked <WH6213> under the sun <WH8121> was grievous <WH7451> to me; <WH1892> for all is vanity and a chasing <WH7469> after wind. <WH7307>
I hated <WH8130> all my labor <WH5999> in which I labored <WH5999> under the sun, <WH8121> because I must leave <WH3240> it to the man <WH120> who comes after me. <WH310>

Who knows <WH3045> whether he will be a wise <WH2450> man or a fool? <WH5530> Yet he will have rule <WH7980> over all of my labor <WH5999> in which I have labored, <WH5999> and in which I have shown myself wise <WH2449> under the sun. <WH8121> This also is vanity. <WH1892>
Therefore I began <WH5437> to cause <WH2976> my heart <WH3820> to despair <WH2976> concerning all the labor <WH5999> in which I had labored <WH5999> under the sun. <WH8121>

For there is <WH3426> a man <WH120> whose labor <WH5999> is with wisdom, <WH2451> with knowledge, <WH1847> and with skillfulness; <WH5998> yet he shall leave <WH5414> it for his portion <WH2506> to a man <WH120> who has not labored <WH5998> for it. <WH1892> This also is vanity and a great <WH7227> evil. <WH7451>
For what has <WH1933> a man <WH120> of all his labor, <WH5999> and of the striving <WH7475> of his heart, <WH3820> in which <WH1931> he labors <WH6001> under the sun? <WH8121>
For all his days <WH3117> are sorrows, <WH4341> and his travail <WH6045> is grief; <WH3708> yes, <WH3915> even in the night his heart <WH3820> takes no rest. <WH7901> This also is vanity. <WH1892>

There is nothing better <WH2896> for a man <WH120> than that he should eat <WH398> and drink, <WH8354> and make his soul <WH5315> enjoy <WH7200> good <WH2896> in his labor. <WH5999> This <WH2090> also I saw, <WH7200> that it is from the hand <WH3027> of God. <WH430>
For who can eat, <WH398> or who can have enjoyment, <WH2363> more than I? <WH2351>

For to the man <WH120> who pleases <WH2896> him, <WH6440> God gives <WH5414> wisdom, <WH2451> knowledge, <WH1847> and joy; <WH8057> but to the sinner <WH2398> he gives <WH5414> travail, <WH6045> to gather <WH622> and to heap up, <WH3664> that he may give <WH5414> to him who <WH6440> pleases <WH2896> God. <WH430> This also is vanity <WH1892> and a chasing <WH7469> after wind. <WH7307>
